#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Paint
#Text=Ceramic Tile
#Text=Ceramic tiles are a staple of many homes .
#Text=Whether they are flooring , a countertop , or a backsplash , their color is n’t always quite right .
#Text=While they are notoriously difficult to paint , there are ways to ensure that your tiles get a beautiful makeover and do n’t lose their new color , without having to replace them .
#Text=By properly preparing the tiles and choosing the right kind of paint and sealer , you can have a beautiful like-new surface in just a few days .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Sanding and Cleaning the Ceramic Tiles
#Text=Sand the tiles to remove any imperfections .
#Text=Use 100-grit sandpaper , rotating the paper in a circular motion to fully sand the tile down , giving you an unblemished surface on which to paint .
#Text=The goal is to get rid of soap scum and hard build-up on the tile surface , as well as to slightly scuff the tile surface .
#Text=You are not trying to remove the glaze of the original tiles , so do n’t worry about sanding the color away .
#Text=Clean the tiles with a heavy-duty , multi-purpose cleaner .
#Text=This will remove any mold or grime clinging to the surface or grout , as well as sanding dust that clung to the tiles .
#Text=Be thorough , as any debris left behind can cause the paint to have trouble holding .
#Text=You can use a combination of one cup bleach with one gallon of warm water instead of a store-bought cleaning solution .
#Text=Let the tiling dry .
#Text=It is important to allow the tiles to fully dry for 24 to 48 hours in order to be sure that your primer and paint coats will keep .
#Text=Check for and repair imperfections in the tile and grout .
#Text=Chips and cracks will affect the ability of the paint to adhere to the tiles , in addition to making it look messy and unprofessional .
#Text=Repair the tiles with epoxy if necessary .
#Text=A properly mixed two-part epoxy will allow you to match the epoxy to the level of the surface tile and paint over it without an issue .
#Text=Mask any nearby surfaces with painter ’s tape .
#Text=Use the tape as a guide , with the straight edges marking the furthest point you wish to cover with paint .
#Text=This will keep anything you do not want to get paint on from getting an accidental new shade .
#Text=Painting the Tiles
#Text=Coat the tiles with a bonding primer .
#Text=An epoxy or latex bonding primer will help the paint adhere much better to the tiles than an ordinary primer would .
#Text=You can apply primer just like a coat of paint , always brushing away from the painter ’s tape .
#Text=Use a paintbrush to apply a coat of paint to the primed tiles and grout .
#Text=Choose a semi-gloss or gloss latex-based paint in order to ensure that it will adhere and fully cover the color below .
#Text=Be sure to fully cover the tiles and grout .
#Text=You can use paint thinner to spread the paint more evenly across the tiles .
#Text=You will be applying multiple coats of paint , so do n’t worry if the color below is still visible after the first coat .
#Text=Allow the paint to dry .
#Text=This may take up to a few days , and no less than 24 hours .
#Text=Check the manufacturer guidelines to see how long you can expect the drying process to take .
#Text=Repeat the painting and drying process .
#Text=Apply as many coats as the paint manufacturer recommends .
#Text=Protecting Your Newly Painted Tiles
#Text=Apply a water-based sealer to the tiles .
#Text=It may take 2 or 3 coats of clear sealer to ensure that the paint will properly adhere and maintain the sheen you want .
#Text=Allow each coat of sealer to dry before adding another .
#Text=Sealing the paint will protect it from the risk of tarnishing , chipping , and fading that painting ceramic tiles comes with .
#Text=Remove the painter ’s tape to reveal a straight even edge .
#Text=Below the tape there will be no paint , so your ceramic tiles will now have a perfect border .
#Text=You can paint over any blemishes or missed spots that the painter 's tape covered up , but be sure to let them dry .
#Text=Paint the grout with grout paint , if desired .
#Text=If you want to keep the look of tile , you may choose to carefully apply a coat of grout paint to the grout you painted over , making sure to avoid the tile itself .
#Text=This will highlight the clean , crisp look that tile is known for .
#Text=Care for the tiles once the sealer has dried .

#Text=It is important to take care of your freshly painted ceramic tiles by sweeping and vacuuming them if they are part of the floor , or dusting and wiping them down if they are part of a countertop or backsplash .
#Text=You can use floor mats to help protect your painted tile floor from scuff marks .
#Text=Clean the painted ceramic tiles with gentle tools .
#Text=Always use neutral pH cleaners and avoid abrasive implements like steel wool or scouring brushes .
#Text=Soft tools like mops and cloths are a better choice .
#Text=Allowing water or cleaners to stand on ceramic tile can strip the paint , so you should be sure to clean up spills quickly .
